results.title: Merseyside
results.brief_description: A survey of the Mersey River, one of the main arterials of Britain’s commerce from its soucre in the Derbyshire hills to its estuary below the port of Liverppol. As the river enters the sea, it is lined with docks, shipyards, and warehouses, which serve the continuous traffic on the Mersey River.

results.title: Meow meow
results.creator_credit: Red Grooms, Yvonne Anderson, Dominic Falcone, Ruckus Films and Yellow Ball Workshop
results.brief_description: A man and his pet lion. The lion overthrows a kidnapper and becomes a celebrity of New York City, type of city. he stars in a musical, is eventually kidnapped himself, is saved by a black bartender and eats the kidnappers. Totally wild, over the top, visually very colourful and fun animation.

results.title: Men of the footplate
results.brief_description: Presents the work of ayoung man wishing to join the railway. Harry begins working at British Railway as a cleaner. He learns the names and functions of the steam locomotion parts he cleans. His eagerness leads him to progress to the role of fireman, hoping to eventually become a driver. Commentary by Frank Phillips.

results.title: Memento
results.creator_credit: Stefan Sharff and Centre for Mass Communication of Columbia University Press
results.brief_description: A fresh approach in the field of automobile safety, Memento uses picture and sound contrapuntally. Photographed in an automobile “graveyard”, the film presents a picture study of cars irreparably smashed in accidents, while the sound track reconstructs the voices of the participants of three particular accidents.

results.title: Melbourne's garden
results.brief_description: Colour studies of the Botanic Gardens; the many-coloured flowering shrubs, unending varieties of floral displays, shade of an oak lawn in summer, rockery plants providing brilliant colour, rose gardens with the newest varieties and the old favourites. The unusual foliage and blossoms to be found the Australian section; the delicate plant which flourish in the shelter of the glasshouses.

results.title: Meet the chief
results.creator_credit: Peter Hadingham, Boy Scouts Association (Great Britain) and Swift Films
results.brief_description: The Chief Scout, Sir Charles MacLean, in his home on the Isle of Mull. He is shown entertaining three Scouts and showing them over the castle where his ancestors have lived for centuries. The 1960 march past of Queen’s Scouts before Her Majesty at Windsor Castle; the Chief Scout’s speech on that occasion. Finally, a message from him to the Scouts of the Commonwealth.

results.title: Meet De Sica
results.creator_credit: Bika De Reisner, Christopher Leigh-Smith and Santa Lucia Productions
results.brief_description: An analysis of Vittorio De Sica, as director, actor, man; relaxed and informal, then occupied and businesslike. De Sica himself guides the narrative and introduces interesting sidelights from his intensively creative life. We learn much of De Sica’s ideas and methods from long detailed excerpts of his films, including Bread, Love and Dreams, Shoeshine, Bicycle Thieves, The Bed, Miracle in Milan.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bika De Reisner, Christopher Leigh-Smith and Santa Lucia Productions

results.title: Mediterranean climate of France
results.creator_credit: Centre Audio-Visuel and Les Films du Sagittaire
results.brief_description: Shows how the Mediterranean climate affects vegetation. The acute shortage of water in summer and the vital necessity for irrigation is shown, also characteristic villages and farmhouses and the grape harvest. Autumn is a time of violent storms punctuated with brief periods of sunshine enabling cultivation of crops and flowers to continue, in spite of the mistral winds of the season.

results.title: Medieval England: the peasants revolt
results.brief_description: The harsh social inequities of the Middle Ages form the background for this film. By focusing on the Peasants’ Revolt of 1381- a determined thrust for freedom by English peasants against the intolerable conditions of the manor - the film examines the grim reality of life in the late Middle Ages. Cast includes Anthony Hopkins, Edward Fox.
